page.title: 15 Marine lake
page.content: Glentworth bay used to be an exclusive area of sea front because it was away from town.Before it was a rocky and romantic inlet. A row of villas were built as rented accomadation during the 1840's and 50's There are shrubs and rock gardens which used to be part of the old Rozel music gardens. In Edwardian times concerts were held here on a covered stage which was called the 'Dutch Oven'. The causeway was built of pebbles in 1828.Proposals for the inclosure of Glentworth came as early as 1871 and were raised several times in the 1880's. The marine lake was reinforced in 1928. A swimming pool near the Grand pier was going to affect the marine lake in
